comment._content: Are those sheets out to dry on the hedges?.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Philip they will be covered in smuts by the engine in due course no doubt! (The sheets I mean) It is a lovely wee engine alright, no doubt some of the experts will give us the detail soon (I hope!)

comment.author: 41996436@N08
comment._content:
Now I'm no expert, but you did ask... 
 This is a Manning Wardle & Co. 'H' class 0-4-0 saddletank engine, probably in their standard livery, green with yellow and black lining, and red wheels and buffer beams. It would have been built in Leeds at their Boyne Engineering Works.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/jack_falstaff] Green, yellow, black and red! It must have been quite the dapper little engine - wish we had a colour shot of it...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
